title: how to get recall50, recall75 log in training?
body:
hello i have some question 

yolo.py 
     class YoloLayer(Layer):
         def call(self, x):
         ....
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, avg_obj], message='avg_obj \t\t', summarize=1000)
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, avg_noobj], message='avg_noobj \t\t', summarize=1000)
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, avg_iou], message='avg_iou \t\t', summarize=1000)
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, avg_cat], message='avg_cat \t\t', summarize=1000)
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, recall50], message='recall50 \t', summarize=1000)
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, recall75], message='recall75 \t', summarize=1000)   
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, count], message='count \t', summarize=1000)     
            loss = tf.Print(loss, [grid_h, tf.reduce_sum(loss_xy), 
                                           tf.reduce_sum(loss_wh), 
                                           tf.reduce_sum(loss_conf), 
                                           tf.reduce_sum(loss_class)],  message='loss xy, wh, conf, class: \t',   summarize=1000)   

How do I get these logs 
from the on_batch_end function in the callbacks during training?


Is there a way to add to the logs parameter in the on_batch_end function?

thanks
